intro: Pristocarpha capitata, commonly known as the clustered globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb with a compact, bushy growth habit, characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its botanical classification places it in the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Pristocarpha capitata thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
